geometry.title: The Circle at Zenith
geometry.description: The full circle — complete, bounded, self-contained. The sphere of the known world. The dome of the sky at noon. The ouroboros of self-referential normality, where the end meets the beginning in a closed loop of status quo.

depth.title: Persona & Surface Self
depth.description: The ego identifies with its persona — the mask self. Like Narcissus, it identifies with its face in reflection. The conscious mind is in full control, and anything inconsistent with its self-image is repressed into shadow. The parent complex transfers parental authority to common sense.

philosophy.title: Materialism & Common Sense
philosophy.description: The surface world is that of common sensory experience — what Kant calls Nature. Plato's world of particulars. Democritus' world of atoms. Everything is separate, everyone is separate. The atomistic worldview as the philosophical foundation of the wasteland.

symbols.light: Full sun, full moon, high noon
symbols.nature: Summer, full bloom, ripe fruit, mature organism
symbols.architecture: The palace, the cave, the Matrix, the Shire, Eden
symbols.figures: The dragon Thou Shalt, the All-Seeing Eye, Santa, the Nursery
symbols.state: Normality, denial, fine, everything is awesome, explosive armor

geometry.title: The Crack / The Descending Line
geometry.description: A crack appears in the circle. A line descends from the zenith. The first diagonal — the falling trajectory of a meteor, a star, a disruption. The geometry of separation begins as something splits from the whole.

depth.title: Shadow Disruption & Blunders
depth.description: The shadow makes itself known through slips, synchronicities, and anomalies. Freudian blunders reveal what has been repressed. The unconscious sends disruptions into the ordered world of ego — dreams that don't fit, desires that contradict the persona, encounters that crack the shell.

philosophy.title: Anomaly & Paradigm Crisis
philosophy.description: Problems with the status quo present themselves as anomalies beyond permitted explanation. Like the Michelson-Morley experiment ignored for decades until Einstein accepted it as a call. Like Hume's attack on causality that woke Kant from dogmatic slumber. The crack in the paradigm.

symbols.light: Afternoon shadows, waning gibbous, lengthening darkness
symbols.nature: Autumn colors, harvest, ripening fruit, mating calls
symbols.architecture: The oracle, the crack, the telegram, the knock at the door
symbols.figures: The Mentor, the Herald, the Fool (Tarot), the Sphinx
symbols.state: Restlessness, calling, disruption, the first question

geometry.title: The Threshold / The Horizon Line
geometry.description: The horizontal line of the horizon — the boundary between above and below, known and unknown, day and night. The threshold is a liminal geometry: neither here nor there. The gate, the door, the mouth of the whale, the surface of the sea.

depth.title: Descent into the Unconscious
depth.description: The ego crosses into the domain of the unconscious. Water represents the unconscious — to be swallowed by the sea is to enter dream logic. The blindfold of initiation removes familiar orientation. Oedipal separation trauma is evoked by every departure from safety.

philosophy.title: Crossing Between Worlds
philosophy.description: The departure from the phenomenal world of Kant's Nature into the noumenal realm of things-in-themselves. The philosopher leaves Plato's cave. The boundary between the material and the immaterial, the seen and the unseen, the rational and the mythic.

symbols.nature: Falling asleep, planting of seed, death, autumn equinox
symbols.architecture: The gate, the coffin, the whale's mouth, the river Styx, the cave entrance
symbols.figures: The Threshold Guardian, Charon, Seth with his adze, the Veil
symbols.state: Commitment, farewell, descent, the point of no return

geometry.title: The Spiral Descent
geometry.description: The descending spiral — gate after gate, level after level. Like Inanna's seven gates or Dante's nine circles. Each revolution strips another layer. The geometry of progressive deepening, of the labyrinth that seems to turn away from the center while making the only path there.

depth.title: Shadow Work & Ego Deconstruction
depth.description: The ego is progressively deconstructed. Inferior functions of the Shadow and Unconscious are developed while the will begins to fail. Each trial strips another article of identity — like Inanna losing her me at each gate. The ascetic path: resisting bodily influence to purify consciousness.

philosophy.title: Progressive Complications & Testing
philosophy.description: The initiatory trials that test and transform. The ascetic's path of purification. The Buddha's emaciation. The hero's progressive encounters with helpers and enemies. Each obstacle raises the stakes and deepens engagement with truth.

symbols.light: Deep night, waning crescent, winter approaching
symbols.nature: Dream journey, gestation, decomposition, approaching winter
symbols.architecture: The labyrinth, the Duat, Dante's circles, the forest, the desert
symbols.figures: Helpers, shapeshifters, tests, the whale's interior

geometry.title: The Point / The Axis Mundi
geometry.description: The single point — the center, the nadir, the axis mundi. The world navel where all lines converge. The innermost chamber. The zero point from which new coordinates emerge. The parentheses of the two crescents — last light going out and first light coming back. Between them: the whispered mystery.

depth.title: Ego Death & Sacred Marriage
depth.description: The ego is annihilated. In its wake, we meet the Self — the totality of being and inner image of God. The hieros gamos (sacred marriage) — the union of opposites. Masculine integrates feminine. The shadow is not defeated but embraced. Atonement with the Father. Meeting with the Goddess. Sunyata (emptiness), Anatman (no-self), Paticca Samuppada (dependent co-arising).

philosophy.title: Extinguishing & Enlightenment
philosophy.description: Nirvana means 'the Extinguishing of the Threefold Fire of Desire, Hostility, and Delusion.' When we put out our fires we can see the stars. The via negativa — truth through annihilation of delusion. Wave-particle duality resolves the paradox of one and many. The empty cup reflects the whole cosmos. The concave mirror Grail projects the light of broader reality into the headspace of the empty self.

symbols.light: Midnight, new moon, winter solstice, extinguished flame, first spark
symbols.nature: Conception, seed germination, deepest dream, death-rebirth pivot
symbols.architecture: Aker, the Bodhi Tree, the innermost cave, the Green Chapel burial mound, the Death Star
symbols.figures: Mara, the Father, the Goddess, the Crescent (death/birth), the Grail, the Sword in Stone
symbols.state: Surrender, annihilation, illumination, the choice, the sacred yes

geometry.title: The Rising Arc / Reassembly
geometry.description: The ascending arc — the curve of the waxing moon. The 14 pieces reassembled. The Megazord maneuver — disparate parts coming together into a unified whole. The geometry of return: not a straight line but a spiral upward, revisiting familiar territory from a new height.

depth.title: Confronting Regression & Reassembly
depth.description: The demons of regression pursue the returning hero. Old patterns try to reassert themselves — neuroses, addictions, habits that were challenged may rebound in desperate defense. But the Self is being reassembled: shadow integrated, anima welcomed, inferior functions developed. The gathering of inner forces for the final push.

philosophy.title: The Road Back & Obstacles
philosophy.description: The challenge of translating transcendent insight into worldly language. Plato's philosopher dreads returning to the cave. Newton feared ridicule. The hero must find motivation beyond the compulsion of defeated complexes. Project Pirate Ship — how to transform the systems from within.

symbols.light: Pre-dawn, waxing crescent, late winter, approaching spring
symbols.nature: Labor, gestation complete, rising from deep sleep, thawing
symbols.architecture: The road back, the chase sequence, the gathering hall, the pirate ship
symbols.figures: Khepri (scarab), pursuing demons, the team, ants who remember kindness
symbols.state: Momentum, pursuit, gathering, the long climb, paving the way behind you

geometry.title: The Horizon Crossed / Mountain Sunrise
geometry.description: The ascending line crosses the threshold — sunrise over the mountain. The geometry of emergence: the vertical axis of the fully risen self intersecting the horizontal plane of the world. The climactic horizon where all elements converge in a single transformative instant.

depth.title: Individuation Complete / Master of Two Worlds
depth.description: The ego is reassembled upon a new foundation — not the old narcissistic ego but one centered in Self. The Master of Two Worlds can move between conscious and unconscious, between the mythic and the mundane, between the game and the knowledge that it is a game. The old Self is proven completely dead; the new Self is immune to old temptations.

philosophy.title: Climax & Delivery
philosophy.description: The delivery of the elixir that redeems the wasteland. The passage from the mythological hero is inward — into depths where obscure resistances are overcome and long lost powers are revivified for the transfiguration of the world. The essence of oneself and the essence of the world: these two are one. Wherever the hero may wander, he is ever in the presence of his own essence.

symbols.light: Sunrise, first quarter moon waxing, spring equinox, Easter
symbols.nature: Birth, sprouting, awakening, spring equinox, green-up
symbols.architecture: The mountain summit, the horizon, the return threshold, the shimenawa
symbols.figures: Horus, the risen Christ, the newborn child, the butterfly, the drawn sword
symbols.state: Arrival, transformation, delivery, the inevitable-unexpected climax

geometry.title: The New Circle / The Spiral Complete
geometry.description: A new circle begins — but at a higher level of the spiral. The geometry of renewal: not a closed loop but an open spiral that encompasses the old while transcending it. The Blue Marble seen from space — no lines, no boundaries, a civilization on the way to wholeness.

depth.title: The Realized Self / Freedom to Live
depth.description: The fully individuated person — the Knight of Faith who returns to life as a clerk. The Zen master at home, smoking cigarettes, drinking a beer. The one who knows the game is a game but plays it fully. The Cosmic Dancer who does not rest heavily in a single spot but gaily, lightly, turns and leaps from one position to another.

philosophy.title: Renewal & The Eternal Return
philosophy.description: The world is regenerated. The wasteland is redeemed. But the happy ending is not a literal promise — it is a transcendence of universal tragedy. The reconciliation of individual consciousness with universal will. The shift from transcendence to immanence — seeing the sacred everywhere, even in the mundane. This our worldly life is an activity of nirvana itself.

symbols.light: Morning, waxing gibbous, spring into summer, growing days
symbols.nature: Growth, nurturing, the garden renewed, children at play
symbols.architecture: The renewed kingdom, Platform 9¾, the Shire restored, the new world
symbols.figures: The Child (Nietzsche), the Bodhisattva, Sam Gamgee, the next generation
symbols.state: Presence, play, continuity, the first step again, freedom
